summary: This is an email chain between federal prosecutors and FBI personnel regarding the collection of communications and materials for 3500 productions in the Epstein/Maxwell investigation. It outlines deadlines and categories of materials needed from FBI agents and victim specialists.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: The sender of the email, coordinating with FBI personnel to gather materials for court-ordered 3500 productions in the Epstein/Maxwell case.

events.title: Deadline for material collection
events.description: Deadline for FBI personnel to provide communications and materials to prosecutors for review and processing for 3500 productions.

keyFacts: Prosecutors are requesting all communications (emails, texts, chats) between FBI agents/victim specialists and witnesses or their attorneys in the Epstein/Maxwell investigation.
The request covers all witnesses, regardless of whether they are testifying or were part of the 'Maxwell phase' of the investigation.
Prosecutors also need all internal and external communications, reports, and notes from specific FBI agents about the Epstein/Maxwell investigation.
The deadline for material collection is September 10, 2021, to meet court-ordered 3500 production requirements.
The email indicates ongoing preparation for legal proceedings in the Epstein/Maxwell case as of August 2021.
